# People, Space, and Statistics {.title .text-light .pt-md-2}

::: {.lead .quoted .text-light .d-block .mt-3 .mt-md-0 .mb-md-3 .animate__animated .animate__slideInLeft}
Informed citizens make better policy choices; better policies save <span class="text-warning">lives</span> and <span class="text-warning">resources</span>.
:::

:::

::: {.column-margin .shaded .shadow-inset .text-body .px-3 .mt-md-3 .animate__animated .animate__slideInDown style="background:linear-gradient(0deg, var(--bs-light) 70%, transparent 80%);"}

![](posts/resume/_fig/profile.jpg){.img-rounded .d-block .mx-auto width="9em"}

A personal blog where I dabble on **econometrics**, **spatial statistics**, **remote sensing**, and **scientific visualization** -- with code samples in **R**, **Python**, **JS** and **D3.js**.

Topics range from **sustainable agriculture** and **food security**, to policies for equitable **growth and development**, to the **geopolitics of natural resources**.

You'll also find book and article reviews, and the occasional opinion pieces. Check out my [full Bio](./posts/resume/index.qmd) for contact details.

::: {.border .striped .px-2 .pt-2 .mb-2}
